thread.title: ‘Drip Drip’: Senate Committee Will Question Jared Kushner Over Russia Ties
thread.title_full: ‘Drip Drip’: Senate Committee Will Question Jared Kushner Over Russia Ties

author: Jon Levine
title: ‘Drip Drip’: Senate Committee Will Question Jared Kushner Over Russia Ties
text:
‘Drip Drip’: Senate Committee Will Question Jared Kushner Over Russia Ties by Jon Levine | 8:02   
The congressional and FBI inquiry into Donald Trump’s campaign ties to Russia took another step closer to the commander-in-chief, Monday, with the New York Times reporting that Jared Kushner has been summoned for questions before the Senate Intelligence Committee. 
Kushner, who is married to first daughter Ivanka Trump , currently serves as a key White House advisor. 
It is known that Kushner met with Russia’s ambassador to the United States, Sergey Kislyak , at least once during his father-in-law’s presidential campaign and sent an aide to meet with him on a subsequent occasions. In addition to Kislyak, the Times reported that Kushner also met with Sergey N. Gorkov, an oligarch who leads a Russian bank currently under U.S. sanctions. 
Within minutes of the story’s publication, co-author Maggie Haberman called into New Day from an Acela Train. 
“This is the highest person to be touched by this investigation so far,” she told co-hosts Chris Cuomo and Alisyn Camerota .”Also the only person so far still serving in the administration.” Haberman noted Attorney General Jeff Sessions’ recusal from any investigation. 
Haberman was careful to stress that the meetings alone did not suggest any wrongdoing, but that it was “yet another in a series of drip drip” revelations emerging from the White House.
